sorular.soru: In what situation should you give way to the other road user?

feedback.metin: In the upper left situation, you are approaching priority triangles and sign B6. This means that you must give way to drivers on the intersecting road. Because a pedestrian is not a driver, you do not have to give way to them. In the upper right situation, the cyclist is coming from the right relative to you. It is an equivalent intersection. The speed bump markings or a different kind of hard road surface such as cobblestones, do not change a thing about this. You must give way to the cyclist. In the lower left situation, the cyclist is coming from the right relative to you. It is an equivalent intersection where you must give way to drivers coming from the right. You must give way to the cyclist. In the lower right situation, the moped rider is approaching priority triangles where they must give way to drivers on the intersecting road. You do not have to give way to the moped rider.

sorular.soru: In which situation is it allowed to overtake on the right?

feedback.metin: Overtaking on the right is allowed just before and on a roundabout (upper left situation). It is also allowed on the right side of the block marking, to overtake vehicles on the left side of that block marking (bottom left situation). Overtaking on the right is also allowed when the vehicle in front of you is pre-sorted to turn left (bottom right situation). Overtaking on the right is not allowed in the upper right situation. There is no traffic jam and no block marking. In this case overtaking is only allowed on the left.

sorular.soru: Which sign indicates a speed limit?

feedback.metin: The right answer is sign A-1,  sign A-3 and sign G-5. The A-1 sign indicates a speed limit of 50 km/h. The A-3 sign can be found on matrix signs above the carriageway. This also indicates a speed limit, and not a recommended speed. The A-4 sign does indicate a recommended speed and not a speed limit. The G-5 sign indicates the entrance of an erf and therefore also indicates a speed limit. The speed limit within an erf is 15 km/h.

sorular.soru: After which sign are you allowed to make a U-turn?

feedback.metin: It is only allowed to make a U-turn after sign H-2. This sign indicates the end of the built-up area. Sign G-1 indicates a motorway, sign G-3 indicates an autoweg. Making a U-turn is prohibited on both of these road types.
